summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit for August 3, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it represents the type of routine prison logs in use at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Routine Inmate Observation Checks
events.description: Staff at MCC New York Special Housing Unit conducted mandatory 30-minute observation checks on inmates in continuous locked-down status throughout the day and night.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit dated August 3, 2019.
The logs detail a 30-minute inmate observation schedule, requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The logs were reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, as indicated at the bottom of each sheet.
The document shows standard prison operational procedures for monitoring inmates in administrative detention or disciplinary segregation.
The logs cover multiple tiers (Z, ZA, ZB, L, M, J, K) within the Special Housing Unit, indicating a multi-cell monitoring operation.
